name: Marianne Williamson
desc: Marianne Williamson is an American author, spiritual leader, and political activist. She is the author of fourteen books, including four New York Times number one bestsellers in the spirituality genre. She is also the founder of Project Angel Food, a volunteer food delivery program that serves home-bound people with HIV/AIDS and life-threatening illnesses, as well as the co-founder of the Peace Alliance, a nonprofit education and advocacy organization.

name: Nikki Haley
desc: Nikki Haley is a conservative political activist. From 2011 to 2017, Haley served as the Governor of South Carolina. In 2017, she was appointed to the role of U.N. Ambassador by President Trump. Haley has argued that she offers generational change, as well as a return to more classical, Reagan-era conservative values.

name: Vivek Ramaswamy
desc: Vivek Ramaswamy is an American entrepreneur, author, and conservative political activist. As the author of multiple political commentary novels, he has been called one of the intellectual godfathers of the 'anti-woke' movement. Founder of Roivant Sciences, Ramaswamy is seeking to reiterate the Trump era of American politics.

name: John R. Bolton
desc: John R. Bolton is the former National Security Advisor to President Trump, having previously served as United Nations Ambassador under President George W. Bush (2005-2007). As a prominent foreign policy scholar, Bolton has become known for his criticism of President Trump, particularly of his isolationist foreign policy positions.

name: Bill Weld
desc: Bill Weld is the former two-term Governor of Massachusetts. Originally elected in 1990, Weld became a staple of the centrist, New England brand of Republican politics, lowering taxes while upholding liberal social policy. Weld previously sought the presidency in 2020, becoming a stiff challenger to President Trump for the Republican nomination.

name: Jerome Segal
desc: Jerome Segal is a socialist political activist from the state of Maryland. A perennial candidate for several state offices, Segal originally left the party in 2020 to found the leftwing Bread and Roses Party, before switching back to the Democratic Party within a year. Segal is seeking the presidency largely as a protest candidate in order to elevate his economic ideals.

name: Corey Stapleton
desc: Corey Stapleton is the former Secretary of State of Montana, originally elected to the position in 2016 and serving a single term. Previously a State Senator, Stapleton has attempted to brand himself as the rightwing version of former presidential candidate Andrew Yang. he has launched a single-issue campaign that is meant to garner attention from younger voters.

name: Perry Johnson
desc: Perry Johnson is an American businessman and politician from Michigan. A member of the Republican Party, Johnson is the author of several books on international quality standards and certification. In 2022, he ran for the Republican nomination for governor of Michigan, but was disqualified from the primary ballot. He is a socially conservative, business Republican.
